fork_status.highlight: Sepolia Fusaka hard fork completed successfully with only minor operator update issues
First BPO activation tomorrow (Oct 21) - increasing blob limits to 10 target/15 max
Hoodi hard fork scheduled for October 28

documentation.highlight: Blog post coming about blob proof computation requirements
Blog post about 16M transaction cap limit with Osaka - critical for pre-signed transactions

client_updates.highlight: Prysm releasing new RC with bug fixes for Holesky
Erigon 3.2.1 released - fixes invalid block production on Holesky
Geth adding automatic blob transaction conversion for L2s still using old format
Besu and Teku have optional releases available
Holesky already running at 60M gas limit

critical_infrastructure.highlight: Holesky testnet shutting down by Oct 31 - urgent migration needed
Non-finality expected by end of this week as operators already shutting down nodes
Blog post reminder about Holesky shutdown to be published this week

testing_progress.highlight: BAL (Block-level Access Lists) DevNet-0 nearly ready with Besu, Geth, Nethermind
EPBS Beta-0 spec finalized for DevNet-0
RPC compatibility improving - Nethermind passed 13% more tests this week

organizational.highlight: All testing communication consolidating to Steel Discord server - one channel per client team

action_items.action: Release blog post about transaction cap limit and pre-signed transaction considerations
Update blog with Lighthouse, Erigon, and other client releases
Work on blog post reminder about Holesky shutdown
Reach out to pandaOps if ePBS implementations are ready for early testing

decisions.decision: Keep trustless payments mechanism as currently specified for EPBS
Consolidate all testing communication to Steel Discord server channels

targets.commitment: First BPO activation scheduled for October 21st (10 target/15 max blobs)
Hoodi hard fork scheduled for October 28th
BAL DevNet-0 setup starting this week with Besu, Geth, and Nethermind
EPBS Beta-0 spec finalized and ready for DevNet-0
EPBS Beta-1 release planned for later this week
